hchid.description: The hierarchy ID (hchID) is a specific identifier attributed to an Orphanet classification.
hchid.name: hchid

language.description: Specify the language in the list supported by Orphanet (CS, DE, EN, ES, FR, IT, NL, PL, PT)
language.name: language

orphacode.description: a unique and time-stable numerical identifier attributed randomly by the database upon creation of the entity.
orphacode.name: orphacode

symbol.description: The symbol is an identifier to reference a gene
symbol.name: symbol

info.description: Orphadata API provides several GET to facilitate the exploitation of various rare disease-related datasets: - Rare diseases aligned with terminologies and databases - Classification of rare diseases - Clinical signs and symptoms in rare diseases - Genes associated with rare diseases - Medical speciality of rare diseases (Linearisation) - Epidemiology of rare diseases - Natural history of rare diseases More information on data are available here. These data are updated twice a year (July and December) and are also available as downloadable files both in XML and JSON formats. We apply the Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) to all copyrightable parts of our databases. This means that you are free to copy, distribute, display and make commercial use of these databases in all legislations, provided you give us credit. For further information, consult Orphadata website and other services from Orphanet. Contact Orphadata team
info.title: Orphadata API

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases information (ORPHAcode, preferred term, the stable URL pointing to the specific page of the clinical entity on the Orphanet website, group and type) and their genes associations. For each gene, symbol, synonyms, name, typology, chromosomal location and cross-mappings with other international genetic databases are also available.
get.summary: Get rare diseases associated to at least one gene.

get.description: The result is a collection of genes associated to at least one rare disease. Each gene is presented by its name(s) and symbol(s).
get.summary: Get the list of genes associated to at least one rare disease.

get.description: The result is a set of data including ORPHAcode, preferred term, expertlink, group and type of the selected clinical entity, relationship between genes and the searched disease and symbol, synonyms, name, typology, chromosomal location and cross-mappings with other international genetic databases of selected genes.

parameters.description: a unique and time-stable numerical identifier attributed randomly by the database upon creation of the entity.
parameters.name: name

get.summary: Get rare disease and associated genes searching by a chain of characters contained in a gene name.

get.description: The result is a collection of diseases associated to the given symbol gene. The result includes ORPHAcode, preferred term, expertlink, group and type, relationship between diseases and the searched gene. Symbol, synonyms, name, typology, chromosomal location and cross-mappings with other international genetic databases of genes are also available.

parameters.description: a unique and time-stable numerical identifier attributed randomly by the database upon creation of the entity.
parameters.name: symbol

get.summary: Get rare diseases information searching by symbol of associated gene.

get.description: The result is a collection of diseases data including ORPHAcodes and preferred term.
get.summary: Get the list of rare diseases associated to at least one gene.

get.description: The result is a set of data including ORPHAcode of the given disease, preferred term, expertlink, group and type, relationship between diseases and the searched gene. Symbol, synonyms, name, typology, chromosomal location and cross-mappings with other international genetic databases of genes are also available.

parameters.description: a unique and time-stable numerical identifier attributed randomly by the database upon creation of the entity.
parameters.name: orphacode

get.summary: Get rare disease information and gene association searching by an ORPHAcode.

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases including their ORPHAcode, preferred term, classification ID, classification tag, direct children and parents.

hch_tag.example: Orphanet classification of rare cardiac diseases

get.summary: Get the list of rare diseases available in all classifications.

get.description: The result is a collection of the unique identifier of each classification and its name (Tag).

hchTag.example: Orphanet classification of rare cardiac diseases

get.summary: Get the list of classifications available.

get.description: The result is a collection of ORPHAcodes organised as children and parents in the selected classification.

parameters.description: The hierarchy ID (hchID) is a specific identifier attributed to an Orphanet classification.
parameters.name: hchid

hch_tag.example: Orphanet classification of rare neurological diseases

get.summary: Get the organisation of an ORPHAcode rare disease available for a selected classification.

get.description: The result is a collection of diseases data including ORPHAcodes and preferred term in the selected classification.

parameters.description: The hierarchy ID (hchID) is a specific identifier attributed to an Orphanet classification.
parameters.name: hchid

get.summary: Get the list of rare diseases available for a selected classification.

get.description: The result is a collection of ORPHAcodes and their preferred term in the classification.
get.summary: Get the list of all ORPHAcodes and their preferred term in the classification.

get.description: The result is a collection of ORPHAcodes organised as children and parents in all classifications where the given ORPHAcode is present.

parameters.name: orphacode

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases including ORPHAcode, the stable URL pointing to the specific page of the clinical entity on the Orphanet website, preferred term, synonyms, definition, the group and type, and the characterisation of the alignment between the rare disease and ICD-10, UMLS, MesH, MedDra, and OMIM systems.

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

DisorderMappingICDRelation.example: Attributed (The ICD code is attributed by Orphanet)

DisorderMappingRelation.example: NTBT (ORPHA code's Narrower Term maps to a Broader Term)

Definition.example: A rare primary bone dysplasia characterized by the association of multiple epiphyseal dysplasia with macrocephaly and dysmorphic facial features (such as frontal bossing, hypertelorism, flat malar region, low-set ears, and short neck). Patients are of normal stature and present with joint swelling and genu valgum. Additional reported manifestations include clinodactyly, spindle-shaped fingers, and pectus excavatum.

get.description: The result is a collection of disease matching with the given ICD-10 code. Results include ORPHAcode, preferred term, synonyms, definition, the group, and the characterisation of the alignment between the rare disease and ICD-10, UMLS, MesH, MedDra, and OMIM systems in a selected language.

parameters.description: ICD-10 reference
parameters.name: icd

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

DisorderMappingRelation.example: E (Exact mapping: the two concepts are equivalent)

Definition.example: A rare neurodegenerative disorder of the astrocytes comprised of two clinical forms: Alexander disease (AxD) type I and type II manifesting with various degrees of macrocephaly, spasticity, ataxia and seizures and leading to psychomotor regression and death.

Definition.example: A rare inflammatory disease characterized by an acute febrile, systemic, self-limiting, medium-vessel vasculitis primarily affecting children. It often causes acute coronary arteritis which is associated with coronary arterial aneurysms (CAA) that may be life threatening when untreated.

parameters.name: lang

The source and the status of the annotation is also available.

get.summary: Get the natural history data of a given rare disease in a selected language searching by its ORPHAcode.

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases with their associated HPO phenotypes. The association is characterized by frequency (obligate, very frequent, frequent, occasional, very rare or excluded) and whether the annotated HPO term is a major diagnostic criterion or a pathognomonic sign of the rare disease. The source (PMID references), the date and the validation’s status of the association are also available.

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

get.summary: Get the list of rare diseases with their associated phenotypes in a selected language.
tags: Clinical signs and symptoms in rare diseases

get.description: The result is a collection of HPO phenotypes including their ID and term in the selected language.

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

get.summary: Get the list of HPO phenotypes in a selected language.
tags: Clinical signs and symptoms in rare diseases

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases matching with the given list of HPO identifiers including ORPHAcode, the stable URL pointing to its specific page on the Orphanet website, preferred term, the group, and the associated HPO phenotypes characterized by frequency or indication if the HPO term is a major diagnostic criterion or a pathognomonic sign. The source (PMID references), the date and the validation’s status of the association are also available.

parameters.description: a comma-separated list of HPO IDs
parameters.name: hpoids

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

get.summary: Get rare diseases information searching by a list of HPO identifiers in a selected language.
tags: Clinical signs and symptoms in rare diseases

get.description: The result is a collection of rare diseases data including ORPHAcodes and preferred term in the selected language.

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

get.summary: Get the list of rare diseases annotated with HPO phenotypes in a selected language.

get.description: The result is a set of data including ORPHAcode of the given disease, the stable URL pointing to the specific page of the clinical entity on the Orphanet website, preferred term, the group, associated characterized HPO terms, the source (PMID references), the date and the validation’s status of the annotation in the selected language.

parameters.description: a unique and time-stable numerical identifier attributed randomly by the database upon creation of the entity.
parameters.name: orphacode

parameters.description: A language in the list supported by Orphanet
parameters.name: lang

get.summary: Get rare disease information and associated HPO phenotypes searching by its ORPHAcode in a selected language.

externalDocs.description: Get rare diseases information and their alignements with other terminologies. Available in english, french, german, spanish, dutch, italian, portuguese, polish, czech, russian, chinese and turkish. For more information, read

tags.name: Rare diseases aligned with terminologies and databases

externalDocs.description: Get Orphanet classifications and the list of rare diseases classified in. Available only in english. For more information, read
Get rare diseases and associated HPO phenotypes. Available in english, french, german, spanish, dutch, italian and portuguese. For more information, read

tags.name: Clinical signs and symptoms in rare diseases

externalDocs.description: Get rare diseases and associated gene. Available only in english. For more information, read

The polyparental structure of the Orphanet classification of rare diseases implies that a rare disease is included in as many classifications as necessary depending on its clinical presentation and the medical specialties to which it is relevant. In order to enable the sorting out of all rare diseases by medical specialty and avoid multiple counting of multiclassified entities in statistical analysis, a linearisation process is applied in the Orphanet database to attribute one medical specialty to each clinical entity. The medical speciality is displayed as «Preferential parent». Available only in english. For more information, read
Get epidemiological data on rare diseases. Available only in english, french, german, spanish, dutch, italian, portuguese, polish and czech. For more information, read

Get inheritance, interval average age of onset and interval average age of death on rare diseases. Available only in english, french, german, spanish, dutch, italian, portuguese, polish and czech. For more information, read
